entry.title: dotnet/aspnetcore - Issues & Pull Requests - 2024-01-13
entry.content:
Issues

Created

  • Published size improvement: todosapipublishaot, todosapipublishaot, todosapipublishtrimr2rsinglefile #53352
  • Perf improvement: plaintext #53351
  • Published size improvement: todosapipublishaot, todosapipublishaot, todosapipublishtrimr2rsinglefile #53348
  • Published size improvement: todosapipublishaot, todosapipublishaot, todosapipublishtrimr2rsinglefile #53347
  • Add ability to scaffold .Net core 8 api endpoints in project and override these #53343

Closed

  • You must install or update .NET to run this application. #53260
  • Perf regression: fortunes, json, json #53278
  • Perf improvement: https, mvc #53345
  • Perf regression: fortunes_ef #53346
  • There are multiple .NET runtimes present, so a default dispatcher could not be resolved. Use DotNetObject to invoke .NET instance methods. #53330
  • Unhandled ChannelClosedException while debugging #53325
  • Perf improvement: caching, plainTextWithFilter #53320
  • [Feature] JS colocation without config #53319
  • Blazor SSR incorrect DOM patching for checkbox/radio controls #53039
  • Blazor 8 SSR cannot change Pagetitle when StreamRendering is true or when in rendermodeserver prerendering is false #52689

PullRequests

Updated

  • [release/6.0] [Blazor] Fix `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.WebView.props` not getting packed correctly #52973
    Servicing-approved, area-blazor, 6.0.x
  • [release/7.0] [Blazor] Fix `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.WebView.props` not getting packed correctly #52972
    Servicing-approved, area-blazor, 7.0.x
  • [release/8.0] [Blazor] Fix `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.WebView.props` not getting packed correctly #52971
    Servicing-approved, area-blazor, 8.0.x
